page.title: 20MODES OF TRANSPORT
page.content: PUBLIC TRANSPORT IS ALMOST TOTALLY ABSENT FROM THIS AREA SO THAT THERE IS AN UNUSUALLY HIGH INCIDENCE OF CAR OWNERSHIP, WITH SOME FAMILIES HAVING TWO, THREE OR MORE CARS. SOME OF THESE MAY HOWEVER BE "COMPANY VEHICLES" - PROVIDED BY THE EMPLOYER, PARTICULARLY FOR "REPRESENTATIVES" WHO GENERALLY WORK OVER A WIDE AREA. SEVERAL REPS. TEND TO LIVE IN THE AREA BECAUSE OF EASY ACCESS TO THE MOTORWAY SYSTEM. UNFORTUNATELY THERE IS NO LONGER RAIL PROVISION. THERE WAS A TIME WHEN A GOODS LINE WAS OPENED TO TRANSPORT SUGAR BEET FROM LOCAL FARMS TO THE REFINERY AT PETERBOROUGH BUT THIS WAS AXED BY DR. BEECHING IN HIS FAMOUS REORGANISATION OF THE RAILWAY NETWORK. THIS SINGLE ACT WAS SUFFICIENT TO CURTAIL AND FINALLY HALT SUGAR BEET PRODUCTION IN THE AREA AS TRANSPORT OF THE CROP BY ROAD PROVED IMPRACTICAL.
